import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
import plotly.express as ps
import plotly.io as pio
%matplotlib inline

    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

import missingno as msno
n = msno.bar(df,color = "#E88ED1")
source.b75cd542:
plt.style.use("ggplot")
fig,ax = plt.subplots(1,2,figsize=(11,6))
sns.regplot(x = "GRE Score",y = "Chance of Admit ",data = df,ax = ax[0])
ax[0].set_title("Relation between GRE score & Chances of Admission")

sns.distplot(df["GRE Score"],kde=True,ax = ax[1],kde_kws = {"lw":3},hist_kws = {"linewidth":7,"alpha":0.3})
ax[1].set_title("Distribution of GRE Score")
plt.show()
source.331bcdd5:
plt.style.use("ggplot")
fig,ax = plt.subplots(1,2,figsize=(11,6))
sns.regplot(x = "TOEFL Score",y = "Chance of Admit ",data = df,ax = ax[0])
ax[0].set_title("Relation between TOEFL score & Chances of Admission")

sns.distplot(df["TOEFL Score"],bins=18,kde=True,ax = ax[1],kde_kws = {"lw":3},hist_kws = {"linewidth":7,"alpha":0.3})
ax[1].set_title("Distribution of TOEFL Score")
plt.show()

plt.show()

source.35940d5f:
#importing necessary Libraries
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split,cross_val_score
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler

x = df.drop("Chance of Admit ",axis=1)
y = df["Chance of Admit "]
x_train,x_test,y_train,y_test = train_test_split(x,y,test_size=0.2,random_state=42)
source.dd82cf0f:
scaler = StandardScaler()
x_train = scaler.fit_transform(x_train)
x_test = scaler.transform(x_test)
source.cc43dce0:
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.tree import DecisionTreeRegressor
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor,ExtraTreesRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score,mean_squared_error
source.15e3622f:
model_dict = [["LinearRegression", LinearRegression()],["DecisionTreeRegressor" , DecisionTreeRegressor()],
             ["RandomForestRegressor", RandomForestRegressor()],["ExtraTreesRegressor", ExtraTreesRegressor()]]

for name,model in model_dict:
    model = model.fit(x_train,y_train)
    y_pred = model.predict(x_test)
    accuracy = r2_score(y_test,y_pred)
    rmse = np.sqrt(mean_squared_error(y_test,y_pred))
    print(f"The r2 score for {name} model is {accuracy*100}")
    print(f"The Root mean Squared error for {name} model is {rmse}")
    print("-"*70)
source.8a586d19: > Observation: - As the TOEFL score increases the chances of Getting Admission also increases!! - The Number of Applicants with TOEFL score between 100 to 115 is higher.
source.3ef10691: > Observation: - For each case with the increase of GRE Score Chances of Getting admission also increases,but as the GRE Score increases chances of getting into a University with high rating also increases. - For getting into a University with high rating you need a High GRE Score in most of the cases
source.1450369f: > Observation: - Students who have higher CGPA also obtained higher GRE & TOEFL Score! - So ,most of the cases CGPA & GRE Score and CGPA & TOEFL Score are kind of proportional to each other!!

- Our target column is "Chance of Admit" which is continuous value ranging from 0 to 1,so this is a Regression Problem!!
